config_description: Cannot found this configuration description for this configuration.
developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration _d is used in the catena function to determine the size of the graph for hashing a password. It is retrieved using the get_d() method and is used in the flap and while loop to adjust the hashing process based on the value of _d.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The triggering frequency of the configuration _d depends on the values of gLow and gHigh in the while loop. The configuration _d is triggered for each iteration of the while loop, which increments the value of g until it reaches gHigh.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The configuration option _d impacts the size of the graph used in the hashing process. Changing the value of _d will affect how the hashing algorithm processes the input data and ultimately the output hash. A larger value of _d may result in a larger graph size and potentially longer processing time.
